column1: Deficient Foundational Security Controls (Access Control, Encryption, and Awareness Training).
column3: Enforce "Zero Trust" Basics (PR.AC / PR.DS / PR.AT): 1. Mandate Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) for all remote access. 2. Enable AES-256 encryption for data at rest. 3. Conduct mandatory, role-based security awareness training for all staff.

column1: Insufficient Backup & Recovery strategy (Lack of immutability, offline storage, and regular integrity testing).
column3: Deploy Immutable Backup Strategy (PR.IP-4): Adopt the "3-2-1" rule: 3 copies of data, 2 different media types, 1 stored offline/immutable. Test restoration quarterly to guarantee recovery from ransomware without paying ransoms.

column1: Ineffective IT Governance and Risk Management (Failure to update policies during M&A, align controls to business value, and prioritize compliance).
column3: Formalize GRC & Incident Response (ID.GV / RS.RP): Update the Incident Response Plan (IRP) to include specific playbooks for ransomware. Establish a "Risk Register" that quantifies risk in dollars, requiring executive sign-off for any unmitigated risks.

column1: Lack of centralized Security Monitoring and Alerting infrastructure (SIEM/NIDS).
column3: Deploy SIEM & NIDS (DE.AE): Implement a Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) system to aggregate logs. Deploy Network Intrusion Detection Systems (NIDS) at the network perimeter to alert on anomalous traffic immediately.

column1: Lack of a comprehensive, automated Asset Inventory and Management process.
column3: Implement Automated Asset Management (ID.AM): Deploy a continuous discovery tool (e.g., LanSweeper or Tenable) to map all hardware/software. Reconcile this inventory against the procurement list monthly to ensure no "shadow IT" exists.

column1: Absence of a recurring internal/external Audit and Vulnerability Assessment schedule.
column3: Establish Vulnerability Management Program (ID.RA-1): Schedule automated vulnerability scans (weekly) and third-party penetration tests (annually). Link findings directly to a remediation ticket system with strict SLAs for patching.
